Class ServerThread

java.lang.Object
ServerThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
This class handles all the communication with the clients, except the Lobby and Game, using a Socket and ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ServerThread​(java.net.Socket socket)
    Creates an unconnected ServerThread.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void run()  
    void startRunning()
    Makes the connection to the client and keeps it open until it is closed by the client.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • startRunning

      public void startRunning()
      Makes the connection to the client and keeps it open until it is closed by the client. The behavior of this method depends on the "type" or the first String from the String array received in the input.

      For the following "types" this is the behavior:

      Host

      -Creates a new Lobby hosted on a random port number between 4000 and 6999 and outputs the port chosen. Note: If having connectivity problems check if this range of ports are open on the router.

      FriendsList

      -Query database for friends list and output the list of friends.

      Comms

      -Adds a reference of the output connection and the client's username to a HashMap userComms in ServerStart to be used to communicate between players when they are NOT in a game or lobby together.

      askFriendship

      -Sends a friend request to the username indicated at index "1" of the String array received in input, using the the HashMap userComms to know where to send the message. Note: The Client will receive this message in the "type" Comms.

      Register, Login, AddFriend, RemoveFriend, ChangePassword, DeleteAccount, Logout

      -All these types talk to database to try to perform their respective tasks indicated by their names and output the answer.

      If Login is succesfull the username will be saved in a HashSet of logged in users in ServerStart.
